3jpOaMVqNFkPk4GY.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The bard makes cruel, cutting comments that draw blood. All enemies within 30 feet take @Damage[7d6[slashing]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:24|basic:true] save).
3jpOaMVqNFkPk4GY.name: Cruel Performance

Clockwork Dancers.description: Several clockwork humanoid figures armed with spinning blades move throughout the area.
Clockwork Dancers.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:25|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to deactivate the clockworks from the control panel. Two successes are needed to deactivate the trap.
Clockwork Dancers.hazardReset: The trap deactivates after 4 rounds and resets after 1 minute.
Clockwork Dancers.hazardRoutine: (1 action) The clockwork dancers target each creature on the stage within 10 feet of a pillar by a spinning blade Strike.
Clockwork Dancers.name: Clockwork Dancers

Corrupted Draft.description: Discordant music, dance, and poetry combine to build a deep suspicion and distrust of strangers.
Corrupted Draft.hazardDisable: @Check[type:performance|dc:28] to counteract the performance or @Check[type:religion|dc:28] or @Check[type:occult|dc:28] to disrupt the spiritual energy. Two total successes are needed to disable the trap. The mechanical head can automatically disable the trap with two uses of Inspired Recitation.
Corrupted Draft.hazardReset: The hazard stops when there are no conscious creatures in area E3 and resets after 1 minute.
Corrupted Draft.hazardRoutine:
(1 action; emotion, fear, mental, occult) The echoes continue to reverberate, tearing at those in the area and filling them with distrust of others. All creatures in the area take @Damage[(2d10+11)[mental]] damage and must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:28|traits:emotion,fear,mental,occult,damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is immune to the effects for 1 minute.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} by feelings of distrust and anxiety.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.
Corrupted Draft.name: Corrupted Draft

Deadly Workshop.description: Swinging bladed chains whip through the entire workshop.
Deadly Workshop.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) on the control panel on the raised platform deactivates the trap.
Deadly Workshop.hazardReset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.
Deadly Workshop.hazardRoutine: (1 action) The trap swings one slashing blade against every creature in the workshop as 1 action. The entire workshop is treated as difficult terrain because of the sheer number of slashing chains. This trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Deadly Workshop.name: Deadly Workshop

Entangling Shredder Trap.description: Dozens of ropes embedded with steel barbs spring out from the walls when at least two creatures step on the rugs.
Entangling Shredder Trap.name: Entangling Shredder Trap

47MzNPDRPjNVXyj1.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

giy28Fg04joyCqnc.description:
The priest chants a prayer to his deity that invokes the forces of nothingness.

Frequency once per day

Effect All enemies within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} take @Damage[5d6[void]] damage (@Check[type:will|dc:21|basic:true] save).
giy28Fg04joyCqnc.name: Prayer of Oblivion

HLihtp5Ew2uQqkOI.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

LluIjiTpvZ5t9yRk.description:
This ash staff is decorated with animals; wielding it, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify conjuration magic.

Activate Cast a Spell

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

  • Cantrip @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uZK2BYzPnxUBnDjr]{Tangle Vine}
  • 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xqmHD8JIjak15lRk]{Phantasmal Minion}
  • 2nd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9XHmC2JgTUIQ1CCm]{Mist}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WPKJOhEihhcIm2uQ]{Marvelous Mount}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lpT6LotUaQPfinjj]{Summon Elemental}

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.
LluIjiTpvZ5t9yRk.name: Staff of Conjuration

dKMfAMjDZdmIHr7L.description: Krashk ignores the first square of difficult terrain she moves into each time she Steps or Strides.
dKMfAMjDZdmIHr7L.name: Rugged Travel

eKwU3JNxz5DedrUc.description: Krashk deals an additional 1d4 damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of her allies.
eKwU3JNxz5DedrUc.name: Pack Attack

nyTcR9Gj5Ckmlaqy.description:
The mechanical assistant recites an inspiring poem, filling allies with determination and vigor. All allies within @Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws and 10 temporary Hit Points for 1 minute. Once an ally has benefited from this ability, they become temporarily immune to Inspired Recitation for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.MT5gxuuxBaN2RdYf]{Effect: Inspired Recitation}
nyTcR9Gj5Ckmlaqy.name: Inspired Recitation

7QPS7Bzoo5c8BwL3.description: A group of six jinkins can work together for an hour to imbue an item with a curse at a range of 60 feet. While this process is lengthy, it's also unobtrusive and can be performed while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hiding}. Jinkins prefer to use this ability on magic items. The curse makes the item unreliable (@Check[type:flat|dc:5] or waste any action to Interact with or Activate the item), adds a bizarre requirement to use the item, or imparts some other curse of a similar caliber.
7QPS7Bzoo5c8BwL3.name: Tinker

FTQxRR29z5xX3uvr.description:
Before it's activated, this item appears to be an ash rod capped with steel on either end.

Activate 2 Interact, envision

Effect You imagine a specific simple tool, and the any-tool transforms into it. (Usually, you can choose from a tool listed in Chapter 6). This transforms the wooden portion into any haft and the metal caps into spades, hammer heads, or the like, allowing for most basic tools but nothing more complex. You can return the item to its rod form with an Interact action.

TfpnMepCP7CcT5q0.description: Noolik can cause a complex mechanical trap to continue longer than its normal duration. She moves up to her speed and Interacts with a trap. The trap can use its reaction during its next round as well as its routine, although its initiative doesn't change.
TfpnMepCP7CcT5q0.name: Trap Tinker

q3mCqdHIM3h7Dygf.description: Noolik deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Sand Wolf.description:
A sand wolf is an elemental creature which dwells in the sandy deserts of elemental earth that drift to, or have been conjured on, the Plane of Air. Occasionally, these creatures seep through planar rifts or are summoned by elementalists on the Material Plane. Sand wolves are prized as guardians for their relative intelligence, keen perception, and ability to disguise themselves, easily blending with the shifting sands in desert terrain. Cunning and agile, they fiercely pursue any creatures they ambush, no matter how nimble their prey. Sand wolves also have a remarkable ability to sing beautiful, haunting songs, and their music is considered high entertainment among djinn who inhabit the Plane of Air. Many djinni viziers and even certain Material Plane rulers seeking the attention of their peers keep at least one of these creatures in their employ to show off at special events and ceremonies. The wolves' wordless songs evoke both the strength of the earth and the power of wind to erode it.

The Eternal Hourglass

Deep within a cavern in the Plane of Earth is a massive, seemingly indestructible hourglass the size of a small city, its top filled with thousands of sand wolves. As each wolf reaches the opening to the bottom, they are turned to sand and do not reform, instead piling up in a huge mound. It is not clear who constructed or placed the hourglass, how the sand wolves got there, or what—if anything—the hourglass is timing. Some claim the wolves will break loose and rampage freely when the sand runs out, while others believe the glass is counting down to the end of time itself.

CSxBQgkOH3OC3Wpm.description: Sand wolves take 5 additional damage from attacks and effects with the water trait.
CSxBQgkOH3OC3Wpm.name: Water Vulnerability

Qwa6uCGVwCVxgKZg.description:
The sand wolf discorporates into a cloud of whirling sand. It can Stride, moving freely through occupied spaces. Any creatures within those spaces take [[/r 2d10]] damage and must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:19|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The target takes no damage.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect is increased to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}.
Qwa6uCGVwCVxgKZg.name: Choking Sands

WkSKKlly7gJ0yJlm.description:
The sand wolf sings a short, enchanting song. Any creature other than a sand wolf within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:19] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to further susurrating song exposures for 24 hours.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

Critical Failure As failure, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.
WkSKKlly7gJ0yJlm.name: Susurrating Song

k4UJqygV0IIOz6gu.description:
Trigger The sand wolf is hit by an attack

Effect The sand wolf's body falls apart into a cloud of sand. It takes no damage from the triggering attack, and its resistances increase to 8. The sand wolf must spend one action to reform its body before it can move or attack.
k4UJqygV0IIOz6gu.name: Collapse Into Sand

Sand Wolf.name: Sand Wolf

qbGllzuR9XLyFWNM.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
qbGllzuR9XLyFWNM.name: Crude Wooden Religious Symbol of Sarenrae

Scrapborn.description:
In places where magic, alchemy, and engineering converge, there are often unforeseen side effects on the environment and its inhabitants. Scrapborn sometimes result from this strange convergence. Mostly, scrapborn appear to be walking piles of assorted junk, seemingly assembled at random. Their actual bodies are vaguely humanoid with delicate, spongy green skin. They secrete an adhesive that allows them to gather up debris and attach it to their bodies for protection. When these scraps eventually fall off, the scrapborn either reattaches them or replaces them with something new. Despite their resulting bulky appearance, scrapborn remain strong swimmers and display little loss of agility underwater. Scrapborn lack a centralized society, but sometimes congregate in small groups that work together for survival. Typically, this leads to ever-escalating attacks on nearby settlements as the creatures feed upon each other's resentment and work themselves up into a frenzy. They often target places with high-quality armor first so they can improve their odds of survival.

Pretend Knights

Some scrapborn spend a great deal of their time carefully selecting the pieces of armor and other bits they attach to their sticky skin. They might enjoy a particular color or material and cultivate their collection accordingly, striving for a cohesive design over time. A very diligent and patient—or particularly wealthy—scrapborn can even construct a full suit of armor this way and might even be able to pass as a knight, using their bulky armored form to bluff and intimidate anyone who might question them as they walk through a city or castle.

NMF7f7BxrI9NQtIA.description:
Requirements The scrapborn's previous action was a successful claw Strike against a target wearing armor and that armor is not broken

Effect The scrapborn pulls and rips at the target's armor. The target must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:20] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target's armor takes @Damage[1d8[piercing]] damage, ignoring the armor's Hardness.

Failure The target's armor takes @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage, which ignores the armor's Hardness; if this causes the armor to become broken, the scrapborn can incorporate the removed armor piece into its own body and raise its AC by 1 (to a maximum of 22).

Critical Failure As failure, except instead of damage, the target's armor is automatically reduced to its BT and the scrapborn increases its AC by 2.
NMF7f7BxrI9NQtIA.name: Rebuild Armor

uyPLq5ud3u2abZOm.description:
Trigger The scrapborn is damaged by an attack dealing physical damage

Effect The scrapborn directs the damage to one of the pieces of scrap attached to its body and gains resistance 15 against the triggering attack, but its AC is lowered by 2 for 24 hours. The scrapborn's AC cannot be reduced below 16 in this way.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.1wCgwFLJByW8YKyM]{Effect: Sacrifice Armor}
uyPLq5ud3u2abZOm.name: Sacrifice Armor

Scrapborn.name: Scrapborn

1Z63U5zjQKyB6fLu.name: Plane Shift (to Astral Plane, Elemental Planes, or Material Plane only)

ExArN3kiUKJOadE8.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The janni changes a creature's size. This works as a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wzctak6BxOW8xvFV]{Enlarge} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PjhUmyKnq6K5uDby]{Shrink} spell but can target an unwilling creature (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:24] save negates).
ExArN3kiUKJOadE8.name: Change Size

K1xxTPaGxgn26xVn.description:
Usage affixed to a weapon

Activate F Command

Trigger You damage an off-guard creature with a Strike using the Affixed weapon

Requirements You are an expert with the affixed weapon

This black strand of leather is tied to look like a peace knot when the weapon is stowed, but it doesn't hamper drawing the weapon. When you activate the knot, the creature you damaged takes @Damage[1d6[bleed]].

If you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.5Jc2ySGLVi053qpz]{Twist the Knife} feat, the talisman instead deals persistent bleed damage equal to your sneak attack damage.

Uh6PzrwRpiHFbs57.description: A janni can survive on any Elemental Plane for up to 48 hours, after which they take [[/r 1]]{1 damage} per hour until they leave or die.
Uh6PzrwRpiHFbs57.name: Elemental Endurance

The Enmity Cycle.description: Discordant music, dance, and poetry combine to build a deep suspicion and distrust of strangers.
The Enmity Cycle.hazardDisable: @Check[type:performance|dc:26] to counteract the performance or @Check[type:religion|dc:27] or @Check[type:occult|dc:27] to disrupt the spiritual energy. Three total successes are needed to disable the trap.
The Enmity Cycle.hazardReset: A new production of The Enmity Cycle must be arranged; this process usually takes at least 1 week.
The Enmity Cycle.hazardRoutine:
(1 action) The performance continues to sow seeds of enmity, discord, and distrust on those in its area. All creatures in attendance other than Zridi must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is immune to the effects for 1 day.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} for 2 rounds.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} for 1 minute and is certain the source of this fear is their fellow citizens, especially those from places other than their hometown. For 1 week the target suffers a –2 penalty to all Diplomacy skill checks against people from other Thuvian cities and regains the frightened 2 condition whenever they are in one of those cities.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target becomes a carrier for The Enmity Cycle for the next week. The target is compelled to travel to a city other than where they were exposed and recite as many lines from the anbarit as they can recall. Those who hear or witness the performance are treated as if they had attended a performance of The Enmity Cycle, but with a @Check[type:will|dc:23] save
The Enmity Cycle.name: The Enmity Cycle

AjA8NquthUNOI7wa.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
AjA8NquthUNOI7wa.name: Religious Symbol of Ahriman

g6fEsZWFGgN3qMQy.description:
Requirements The Usij cultist must have a whip in their hands

Trigger A creature moves out of a threatened square

Effect The Usij cultist makes a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} attempt against the triggering creature with their whip.
g6fEsZWFGgN3qMQy.name: Tripping Whip

kpbrWPglhL7JPNCJ.description: A vulpinal's core value is cunning. They can apply their knowledge and stories from their extensive travels to just about any situation in an instant. Before spending any other action on their turn, the vulpinal can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} as a free action.
kpbrWPglhL7JPNCJ.name: Fox's Cunning

4FWJV0JycabbbM9J.description:
Zridi can take the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid or animal. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage modifiers with the Strikes, but it might change the damage type her Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

4NDYGQ0N2hZuDmLa.description:
A creature can't remove the fatigued condition while infected

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and fatigued (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}, fatigued, and take @Damage[1d6[bleed]] every [[/br 1d20 #Persistent Damage Interval]]{1d20 minutes} (1 day)
4NDYGQ0N2hZuDmLa.name: Bubonic Plague

69Yqd9iU5oJfTHwA.description:
This large ram's horn perpetually glistens with tiny droplets of water, much like condensation.

Activate 2 Interact

Frequency once per hour

Effect You activate the horn by blowing deeply into it, causing it to issue forth a low blast and cast a 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9XHmC2JgTUIQ1CCm]{Mist} spell. You can Dismiss the mist at any time by blowing a second note on the horn using an Interact action.
69Yqd9iU5oJfTHwA.name: Horn of Fog

Dr6cVFviV7Q2miU8.description: You reshape the magic aura of one creature or object to resemble that of another. You designate one target as the primary target and the other as the secondary target. Effects that would detect auras on the primary target instead detect the same types of auras from the secondary target. A creature reading the aura can attempt to disbelieve the illusion. You can Dismiss the spell from up to a mile away.
Dr6cVFviV7Q2miU8.name: Misdirection (At Will) (Self Only)

UGUWALd2VlYF2YHm.description: Pairakas hate the color red. Zridi won't wear the color or willingly enter any place painted red. Given a choice, she'll attack a creature wearing red first. If barred from expressing her displeasure toward the color by force or some magical effect, she takes @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage at the end of her turn.
UGUWALd2VlYF2YHm.name: Hatred of Red

osoaSGKfsC1ynbq1.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Zridi grants the target a +2 status bonus to Performance checks for one week. The target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:26] save.

Critical Success No further effect.

Success The target must @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EEDElIyin4z60PXx]{Perform} for 1 action on its next turn.

Failure The target must Perform for 3 actions on its next turn, undertaking a Performance task set by Zridi.

Critical Failure As failure, but Zridi can choose to delay the effect and trigger it at any point in the next week as a reaction.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Yb5rg3MEojIHQX8H]{Effect: Compelled Performance}
osoaSGKfsC1ynbq1.name: Compelled Performance

u6YxDEh3edTAjJSk.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Zridi torments a sleeping creature within 100 feet with visions of betrayals by loved ones and friends. The target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:26] save, with the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare} spell.
u6YxDEh3edTAjJSk.name: Tormenting Dreams

Zridi.name: Zridi
Zridi.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
